Info.Description: Designed to reduce noise in the image while preserving sharp edges. It works by replacing each pixel with a weighted average of its neighbors. The weights depend on both the spatial distance and the color difference, which helps to keep the edges sharp while smoothing out noise.

Properties.Name: Sigma
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the size of the area around each pixel that the filter considers when applying the noise removal effect. A larger sigma smooths over a larger area, which can reduce noise but may also blur fine details. A smaller sigma preserves more detail, but may not remove as much noise.

Properties.Name: Threshold
Properties.Summary: Determines the color difference required for a pixel to be included in the noise removal calculation. A higher threshold means that only pixels that are very similar in color to the current pixel are included, which can preserve sharp edges but may not remove as much noise. A lower threshold includes more pixels, which can remove more noise but might also blur edges.

Properties.Name: Intensity
Properties.Summary: Adjusts the overall intensity of the noise removal. A higher intensity results in more noise being removed, while a lower intensity preserves more of the original image detail.
